tn.text: This refers to all the people who live in a house together, usually a large family with servants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"70" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"Joseph lived in Egypt before his brothers"
This includes 10 older brothers and 1 younger brother.

The birth of children to the Israelites is spoken of as if they were plants that were producing fruit. AT: "had many children" or "gave birth to many children" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the land was filled with them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They filled the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "them" refers to the Israelites.
Here "Egypt" refers to the people of Egypt. AT: "began to rule over the people of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"The king said to his people"
These were the people who lived in Egypt, the Egyptians.
The word "us" is inclusive and refers to the king and his people, the Egyptians. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
Here war is spoken of as a person that is able to act. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"leave Egypt"
"slave drivers." These were Egyptians whose job was to force the Israelites to do hard work.

tn.ref: to oppress them with hard labor
tn.text: "to force the Israelites to do hard work for the Egyptians"
These were places where the leaders put food and other important things to keep them safe.
"made ... work very hard" or "harshly made ... work"
The difficult lives of the Israelites are spoken of as if they were bitter food that was difficult to eat. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This was a wet glue or mud put between bricks or stones that held them together when it dried.

tn.ref: All their required work was hard
tn.text: "The Egyptians made them work very hard" or "The Egyptians forced them to work very hard"
The king of Egypt is called Pharaoh.
These were women who helped a woman give birth to a baby.
These are Hebrew women's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Women sat on this short stood as they gave birth. Therefore, it is associated with birth. AT: "as they give birth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These were women who helped a woman give birth to a baby. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:01:15|1:16]].

tn.ref: Why have you done this, and let the baby boys live?
tn.text: Pharaoh asked this question to rebuke the midwives for allowing the male children to live. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "You have disobeyed my order by not killing the male babies!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]).

tn.ref: The Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women
tn.text: The midwives answered wisely to appease Pharaoh's anger.
God kept Pharaoh from killing these midwives.
These were women who helped a woman give birth to a baby. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:01:15|1:16]].
"The Israelites increased in numbers"
"revered God" or "had reverence for God"
"the enabled them to have children"

tn.ref: You must throw every son ... into the river
tn.text: This order was given in order to drown the male children. The full meaning of this may be made explicit. AT: "You must ... into the river so they will drown" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
